required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of EnVisio SmartClip for Intraoperative Localization of Breast Masses
clinical_study.official_title: Physician Initiated Evaluation of EnVisio SmartClip for Intraoperative Localization of Breast Masses

lead_sponsor.agency: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

clinical_study.source: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: This is a pilot study to estimate the success of the SmartClip device for accurate placement and reproducibility of intraoperative identification of in-breast lesions and for excision utilizing surgical navigation indicators.

primary_outcome.measure: Ability of localizing in-breast lesions using the Envisio Navigation and SmartClip system in surgery - Radiologist Cohort
primary_outcome.description: Questions 1,2,5,6,7 & 8 from the Radiologist survey will evaluate the EnVisio system for reproducible in-breast tumor localization by the performing physicians.

primary_outcome.measure: Ability of localizing in-breast lesions using the Envisio Navigation and SmartClip system in surgery - Surgeon Cohort
primary_outcome.description: Questions 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, & 11 from the Surgeon survey will evaluate the EnVisio system for reproducible in-breast tumor localization by the performing physicians.

secondary_outcome.measure: Placement of the SmartClip on preoperative imaging to clip location on specimen radiography
secondary_outcome.description: Radiologists will take radiologist questionnaire evaluating their experience using the SmartClip

secondary_outcome.measure: Placement and visibility of the clip by breast radiologists
secondary_outcome.description: Radiologists will take radiologist questionnaire evaluating their experience using the SmartClip

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraoperative use of the device system by surgeons
secondary_outcome.description: Surgeons will take surgeon questionnaire evaluating their experience using the SmartClip and EnVisio™ Navigation System

secondary_outcome.measure: Surgical outcomes with use of the SmartClip
secondary_outcome.description: Surgeons will take surgeon questionnaire evaluating their experience using the SmartClip and EnVisio™ Navigation System

arm_group.description: Participants will undergo a preoperative physical exam and at least one preoperative ultrasound demonstrating the mass for resection. The SmartClip will be placed under ultrasound guidance. Post-placement mammogram will be obtained after placement of the clip. The SmartClip can be placed up to 30 days prior to the planned surgical resection. At the time of definitive surgery, the Envisio system will be used to identify the clip and the targeted lesion for resection. Intraoperatively, a specimen radiograph will be performed to confirm the presence of the SmartClip and the targeted lesion in the surgical specimen. The breast surgical specimen will be sent for gross examination, including measurements of the tumor in 3 axes. Immediately post-procedure, the performing surgeon will fill out a questionnaire to determine the ability of localizing in-breast lesions using the Envisio Navigation and SmartClip system in surgery.

Radiologist will place SmartClip under ultrasound guidance. A Post-placement mammogram will be obtained after placement of the SmartClip. Immediately post-procedure, the performing radiologist will fill out a questionnaire.
The surgeon will use the EnVisio™ Navigation System to identify the SmartClip and the targeted lesion for resection. Immediately post-procedure, the performing surgeon will fill out a questionnaire

intervention.description: The Envisio SmartClip is an FDA-cleared (approved) device for localization of in-breast lesions. While using The EnVisio™ Navigation System, the system will detect the presence of the SmartClip™ Soft Tissue Marker(s) and provide real-time three-dimensional navigation during the surgery.

The EnVisio™ Navigation System acquires and analyzes electromagnetic signatures that display the relative distance, depth, and direction from the tip of the electrosurgical tool to the implanted SmartClipTM(s) within the surgeon's field of view during the procedure.

study_pop.textblock: Participants will be recruited to this study from the Moffitt Cancer Center Comprehensive Breast Clinic. Patients are seen in this clinic by breast surgeons from the Comprehensive Breast Program at Moffitt Cancer Center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants must have a sonographically identifiable in-breast lesion measuring at least 15mm on ultrasound imaging and consent to undergo a surgical resection using the SmartClip localization system at the McKinley operative suites at Moffitt Cancer Center
- Participants must be age > or = 18 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants with sonographically occult target lesions
- Participants with greater than 35cm chest to bust depth
- Participants undergoing mastectomy for resection of the targeted lesion
- Inability to undergo surgery at the McKinley OR suites due to institutional anesthesia guidelines
